meanings.definition: A colorful bird found in Central America.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful quetzal flew gracefully through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I saw a quetzal perched on a branch, its feathers shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The quetzal and the toucan had a friendly competition for the best-looking feathers.
meanings.sent4: Her vibrant dress resembled the colorful plumage of a quetzal.
meanings.sent5: The quetzal's bright green and red feathers made it stand out among the other birds.

meanings.sent1: In Guatemala, you can use the quetzal to buy souvenirs at the market.
meanings.sent2: The price of the painting was listed in quetzals at the art gallery.
meanings.sent3: He saved up all his quetzals to buy a special gift for his mom.
meanings.sent4: The quetzal in his wallet jingled as he walked down the street.
meanings.sent5: She exchanged her dollars for quetzals before her trip to Guatemala.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Costa Rica.
meanings.sent1: The cost of the meal was 500 quetzals in Costa Rica.
meanings.sent2: She received her change in quetzals after paying for the bus ticket.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted quetzals, not dollars.
meanings.sent4: His pockets were filled with quetzals from his recent trip to Costa Rica.
meanings.sent5: The quetzal coins had unique designs that caught her eye.
